article.headline: Santa Barbara 55, Montana 46
article.story: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. (AP) -- Casey Cook scored 14 points and grabbed 12 rebounds to lead UC Santa Barbara to a 55-46 win over Montana Saturday night. The Gauchos (2-4) held the Grizzlies (4-5) to just 31 percent shooting. Chrismen Oliver's career-high five steals helped lead to 23 turnovers for Montana. UCSB never trailed, though the Gauchos shot just 27.6 percent in the second half (33.9 for the game), enabling the Grizzlies to rally to within four points. Kevin Criswell's layup with 2:32 to go trimmed the Gaucho lead to 47-43. Santa Barbara, however, made 6-of-8 free throws in the final 1:22 to pull out the win. Oliver, who also had a career-high seven assists, added 10 points for UCSB. Corey Easley led Montana with 12 points.
